New Records: This was the first time since 2011 that Ireland has come from behind to win away from home
Key Match Events: Robbie Brady scored a late winner in the 88th minute
Liam Scales scored the equalizing goal in the 57th minute
Pohjanpalo scored for Finland in the 17th minute
Post-Match Reflections: This was the first away win in the UEFA Nations League campaign for the Republic of Ireland
Player of the Match: Robbie Brady
Miscellaneous Highlights: Robbie Brady's late winner sealed the win for Ireland
Finland nearly put themselves back in front in the 62nd minute but Kamara's curling effort just went wide
Others: The Republic of Ireland will travel to Athens for the second match in this international window where they face Greece
